    The methods class for this lab. All parameters will be final and all preconditions will be enforced.

    • Method Detail

      • readNum

        public static int readNum​(Scanner kb)
        The readNum method prompts the user for a number that is between -10000 to 10000. The method ensures the number is in range by continually prompting

        @NOTE: The input buffer will be left cleared before leaving the method
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int Representing the number
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner is null

      • menu

        public static int menu​(Scanner kb)
        The menu method prompts the user for a menu choice. This method ensures that the entered choice is within the range of 1 to 5 inclusive.
        Menu choices are:
        1) Enter a new number
        2) Print the number backwards
        3) Print if the number is light or heavy
        4) Print the primes from 2 to the entered number
        5) Quit


        @NOTE: The input buffer will be left cleared before leaving the method
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int Representing the menu choice, must ensure the number is between 1 and 5 inclusive
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner is null

      • numberBackwards

        public static void numberBackwards​(int theNum)
        The numberBackwards prints the digits in the number in reverse order. If the number is 12345 what will be printed to the screen is 54321. You must do this without the use of String or any String functions
        Parameters:
        theNum - Representing a in range
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number is out of range

      • lightOrHeavy

        public static void lightOrHeavy​(int theNum,
                                Scanner kb)
        The lightOrHeavy method calculates the average of the number passed in. Take the sum of the digits and divide by the total number of numbers in the number passed in.
        Next prompt the user for a second number. Take the sum of the digits and divide by the total number of numbers in the number entered. If the average of the number passed in is greater than the average of the second number than the number is heavy otherwise it is light.

        @NOTE: The input buffer will be left cleared before leaving the method
        Parameters:
        theNum - Representing a number in range
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if theNum is out of range
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner is null

      • printPrimes

        public static void printPrimes​(int theNum)
        The printPrimes method prints the prime numbers from 2 to the passed in number.

        @NOTE: You can't use arrays or any methods from any classes, such as String. You have to brute for the answer
        Parameters:
        theNum - Representing the number in range
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the theNum passed in is out of range
